scopecontent.p: This collection consists of three scrapbooks on theater and opera (1858-1909). The books include illustrations and photographs from magazines and newspapers; cabinet cards, photographs, and cyanotypes; playbills and programs; sheet music; and articles, reviews, and advertisements from magazines and newspapers. Many of the items are for performances in Philadelphia; venues include the Walnut Street Theater, the Arch Street Theater, the Chestnut Street Theater, Garrick's Theater, the Chestnut Street Opera House, and the American Academy of Music. There are also several items from theaters and opera houses in Boston, New York, London, and Paris. One volume is largely focused on the Augustin Daly Company and its Philadelphia performances.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
